title: You Don't Have to Go Into Serious Debt to Have a Wonderful Wedding
text:
You Don't Have to Go Into Serious Debt to Have a Wonderful Wedding Written by: Nicholas Pell 07/28/15 - 2:29 PM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) â€” Getting married might be one of the best days of your life, but it's not going to be one of the cheapest . All told, the average cost of a wedding is over $26,000. If you're someone of modest means, that can be daunting. What's more, many people make the mistake of going into massive debt just to get married. But big spending and big debt aren't necessary to have a memorable wedding. Here are some tips on how to make your special day frugal as well. 
Set a Budget 
The first place where a lot of young couples planning for their wedding go wrong is coming up with what they want, then creating a budget rather than the other way around. "The problem is that brides and their mothers decide that they want something, then figure out how they're going to pay for it," says Ellie Kay, a family financial expert. "Nine times out of ten, that means going into debt ." More Headlines
